There are several treatments available for stroke, including medications, surgery and rehabilitation. The type of treatment will depend on the type of stroke and the severity of the symptoms. They can also be used to prevent blood clots from forming. Surgery can be used to treat hemorrhagic stroke, which occurs when a blood vessel in the brain bursts. This can be treated by removing the blood or by repairing the damaged blood vessel. Rehabilitation can help people recover from stroke. This can include physical, occupational and speech therapy.

Heat stroke is a life-threatening condition that occurs when the body's temperature rises to 104 degrees Fahrenheit or higher. It is caused by the body's inability to cool itself.
